website_summaries.verdict: This beautiful game is ideal for sipping coffee or tea on a cozy night in.
pros: Players build their own colorful mosaics with heavy tiles
Behind the decorative style of the game is a clever little puzzle that will have players agonizing over every tile they take
The double-sided player boards offer a simple or advanced style of play
cons: Gameplay can be quite cutthroat, which may not appeal to some players

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommended
customer_reviews.text: We're really enjoying this game requiring different thinking/playing than most of our other games. Aesthetically, we wish the 2 plain kinds of tiles had been given a design like the other 3 kinds, but this is a great game. We bought a second drawstring bag to put tiles in after play, and that helps with a more smooth flow of the game. We also enjoy playing "blind" sometimes by shielding our boards from view - especially when playing with only two people.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia K.

customer_reviews.title: What a beautiful game I love it my husband loves it we ...
customer_reviews.text: What a beautiful game I love it my husband loves it we are boardgame nerds and we think even other people will like it!
customer_reviews.author: Deni

customer_reviews.title: So much fun!
customer_reviews.text: Great for a small group, short strategy game. It plays quickly and is fast moving for the most part. We play Splendor quite a bit and like Settlers of Catan but were looking fora quick playing new game and this fit the bill. It would make a nice non-traditional wedding gift b/c it's great for playing with company as it's easy to pick up on the rules.
customer_reviews.author: Tara LG

customer_reviews.title: Well built game
customer_reviews.text: The rules of Azul are simple and as one starts to play, well, the feeling is that it is a fun game. But as you get more involved with the game, you realize that it is not as simple as it seems. There are tactical nuances that you only discover as you play and as players become more sophisticated in their strategy. There is much to compromise or risk with choices, depending on what other players are doing. It is an engaging game that lasts a short time and the visual design is beautiful. It has become one of our family favorites, great for those cold winter evenings around the fireplace.
customer_reviews.author: Beza

customer_reviews.title: Mint
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant because I noticed other reviewers who got this came had it come damaged. But I did anyways. Eveything looks mint. The plastic was protecting the box. The game boards are super sturdy. Everything looks mint. Haven't played it yet. Posting this in case anyone else is hesitant. I see no reason to not have this be at 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea lee

customer_reviews.title: Buy from another company that performs QT
customer_reviews.text: BUYER BEWARE!!! Buy from another company. I'm missing 20 black tiles and 20 yellow tiles and this appears to be a common problem despite all the positive reviews. I'd give zero since I wasn't given the required pieces to play this game.
customer_reviews.author: Danny Rooks

customer_reviews.title: Boards in the package had rough, torn edges.
customer_reviews.text: The quality of this makes me think it is a knockoff product rather than the actual producer of the game.
customer_reviews.author: James Todd

customer_reviews.title: Easy to learn, easy to teach, with enough depth that it is fun to return to again and again.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the game because of some good advance buzz and how beautiful it looked. And I have not regretted it! The game play is easy to learn and teach. I've introduced a half dozen groups to it (who are disappointed that it is currently only available at 3 times the normal price from scalpers). But, there are enough different possible strategies that it is fun to play again and again. There's also enough of a random element to the tile draws that my non-linear thinking wife can go toe to toe with her rocket scientist husband. Highly recommended, at normal price.
customer_reviews.author: L. Eldred

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't scale well
customer_reviews.text: Received damaged to boards (mentioned on several other reviews). Don't understand the hype around this one. Works well with two players. Any more than that results in hate picking against the person who is in the lead. Recommend staying away from this one unless you only want to play the two player version.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun!
customer_reviews.text: This is a really fun game. My husband and I like to play games with friends, bu we often find that good group games become less fun when played with just 2 people. But this is one game that's as much fun for 2 players as 4 (although the dynamic does change a bit with 3-4). It is easy to learn, but the more you get into it the more you start to appreciate the strategy. There is also just the right element of chance to prevent one person from winning all the time (without making you feel like your choices don't matter.)
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Knock off
customer_reviews.text: I love this game after playing it with friends and decided to purchase it for myself. Unfortunately, my boards were completely defective. If you've played before, or simply look at the product pictures and Customer Images, you can see that my boards are missing the pattern of tiles so that you know where to place your tile. My boards are blank. I'm waiting now for a replacement and am hoping I don't receive the same defective product.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Beautifully made game, quality pieces.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great game. I’ve played with two and three people everyone enjoyed the game. The tiles are a weighed plastic with very nice feel. The boards are a heavyweight pressed paper board. A very good addition to your gaming collection.
customer_reviews.author: Page

customer_reviews.title: Casually competitive, great for families and friends
customer_reviews.text: A great game. Two things stand out to us. First, our children between the ages of 5-9 all learned the game very quickly and enjoy it; because it is so tactile and color based, the youngest at 5 is able to play. It's also quickly taught to friends who might be visiting. The second thing that stands out is that it is "casually" competitive. One reviewer described it akin to "multi-player solitaire," and there is a sense that while there is competition, and some cross-player strategy, there's no "cut throat" sense when playing; no sending the other player back to Start, or bankrupting them, or stealing their cards, etc. This makes for inner-family play a bit more relaxed!
customer_reviews.author: Singerinkitchen (Noelle K.)

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality control
customer_reviews.text: Box did not come with all 5 tile types unfortunately which was super disappointing as I had played this game originally with my brother and loved it. Buyer beware
customer_reviews.author: Oliver F

customer_reviews.title: Missing components and torn player boards -- otherwise great game
customer_reviews.text: The game itself is great, you can find reviews on boardgamegeek and i would absolutely recommend playing but my box was missing the yellow tiles completely and my boards were damaged and ripped on the edges. i've seen other reviews saying they also received damaged components, something's not right with one of the sellers and i'm returning this for a full refund. i'll pick it up in a reputable store.
customer_reviews.author: Disgruntled_Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing quality
customer_reviews.text: This game is great to play. However I was very disappointed upon opening the box. Two corners of the box were crushed and all of the boards had ripped edges. The pieces were of good quality but I expect to have good quality in all game pieces not just partial.
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: Strategic, fun game!
customer_reviews.text: This is a fun game that’s competitive, but not overly aggressive as far as needing to be out to get the other players. The premise of the game is simple and allows for conversation while playing, but does require some strategy. It’s also a relatively fast game so you’re not playing for hours at a time. One downside is that you should probably have a bag of Starburst on hand, because the playing pieces are very similar in appearance and you’ll be craving them by end of game play.
customer_reviews.author: pukuco

customer_reviews.title: Great game, but lower quality now
customer_reviews.text: Bottom line, this is a very fun and simple game. But if you played a friend's copy that they have had for a couple years, then you were playing with high quality, glossy, glass-like tiles. Now, this game is produced with cheap, dull plastic. Gone is the beauty that this game once carried, which is ironic because the theme of the game has you laying beautiful tile for the king of Portugal. If he saw this low quality trash, let's just say you wouldn't be tiling his castle anymore. Pay extra and find a used copy of the first edition. It is definitely worth it.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonOriginal

customer_reviews.title: Dented
customer_reviews.text: Shipped with dents in the lid. I cannot gift this because of the damages.
customer_reviews.author: ADP

customer_reviews.title: Quick to learn, fun to master!
customer_reviews.text: This has a base learning curve to let you play in minutes, but strategy that will leave you perfecting play each time you bring it out. Simple set up and clean up, beautiful tiles and simple scoring system. This will definitely be one of the first games off the shelf in the future. Only complaint is the two of the tiles varieties have no pattern on them, but I believe they are making new sets to remedy this.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Holloway

customer_reviews.title: High quality, fun game
customer_reviews.text: High quality tiles and bag, medium quality board. Game box is very good. Fun game that you really hit your stride in around your 3rd or 4th match, but I don’t see us playing more than a 10 games overall with the same crowd. Rules are easy once you know them, but take a couple read-throughs of the instruction manual to be sure on everything. Not a game for your non-gamer friends, in my opinion. Worth full price.
customer_reviews.author: DonkeyBelly

customer_reviews.title: Even My Parents Like This One!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I are avid board gamers. We love to play what we like to call "nerd games" - but my parents look at us like we have two heads when we bring out our normal games. We wanted to find something they would play with us without subjecting ourselves to games like Monopoly or Sorry. We are happy to announce that they loved Azul so much that we ended up buying them a copy to play on their own as well!
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Amazing game. Shoddy copies
customer_reviews.text: The game is amazing and thoroughly recommended. But just like a few other people here, I have gotten a copy that came with the edges of the player mats damaged. It seems to be a thing. So I recommend buying the game but buy it from somewhere else if possible. Otherwise, it looks like the luck of the draw whether you get a good copy or a damaged one.
customer_reviews.author: Ples Cristian

customer_reviews.title: Unique and beautiful
customer_reviews.text: Friends introduced me to Azul. I suspect that if I hadn't played first with someone who already knew how to play, it would have been a challenge to learn. That said, I LOVE this game. It has a truly beautiful aesthetic. The tiles are pretty and very satisfying to handle. The gameplay isn't like any other board games that I have personally played, and I really enjoy it. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Valerie M. Holley

customer_reviews.title: Endless permutations!
customer_reviews.text: Don't let the instructions intimidate you - watch an online video to see how to play or ask a friend who's played before. It's easier to understand than to make the rules explicit (i.e. scoring is like scrabble or quarkle, you get points for newly formed things but not everything those things touch, which is hard to write out but easy to understand). We really, really enjoy playing this game. I wish there were expansion packs with new tile boards and colors/sizes. :)
customer_reviews.author: EnglishSp8ker

customer_reviews.title: Great family game
customer_reviews.text: This is a great addition to our family game collection. It is fun with the kids, who love the colors and tactile tiles. It is also fun to play with our adult boardgamer friends. Complex enough for everyone. Simple to learn. Nice game length. Good mix of chance with rewards for good strategy.
customer_reviews.author: IdahoJoe

customer_reviews.title: World-class game, down-to-earth pricing.
customer_reviews.text: This game is fantastic. As the winner of the 2018 Spiel Des Jahres (Game of the Year), Azul makes a fantastic mix of simple rules and deep strategy that is hard to beat. I have yet to meet anyone who has played it who hasn't enjoyed it, and I keep encountering people who like it for different reasons. Just at the last gaming session, one of the players commented that because she was dyslexic, she liked it because once she understood the rules, it didn't require any reading. And at $32 straight from Amazon, it was an easy addition to our game library.
customer_reviews.author: Jason DuVall

customer_reviews.title: Great value for a great time!
customer_reviews.text: An amazing game. Easy to pick up and fun for all types of gamer styles. Very similar to Qwirkle while being unique enough to warrant the purchase. The included pieces are beautiful and there are options to upgrade the more plain pieces. Players take turns acquiring tiles in small batches to complete their display. There is strategy involved to prevent waste for yourself and force your opponents to either slow down or waste tiles (lose points). There are two sided playing mats to change the way you play if you one way gets stale. I highly recommend this game for any collection.
customer_reviews.author: twinjet

customer_reviews.title: Great fun with subtle complexity that sneaks up on you
customer_reviews.text: This deserves all the hype and spiel des jahres nomination etc. it was so easy to learn and teach and then after a couple rounds the depth and strategy suddenly jump out at you and it really engages you. I think this will be one of those that are still on the table 10-20 years from now like the classics
customer_reviews.author: mmalinsk

customer_reviews.title: Game of the year lives up to it's billing
customer_reviews.text: Bought this game as something for my wife and I to do with our children of all ages. It's easy to learn and very enjoyable to play. It requires some decision making, but doesn't require a "strategic" type thinker to win. And anyone can win. What is enjoyable about it, aside from the well designed tiles are the decisions you have to make. do you take tiles to benefit you or to prevent someone else from getting them, even if it means you take a penalty? My 10 year old daughter beat me the first couple of times and all of us have tremendously enjoyed this game. It's now a regular for us on family game night!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Like any great game, easy to learn, tough to master
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Relatively easy to learn, games are fast, tiles are neato Cons: Tiles can easily slide off the board It's frustratingly easy to accidentally knock the game tiles off the board and even easier to do with your scoring piece. A perforated game board would be nice. But aside from that, it's brilliant. It's for two to four players but three feels ideal. Once you get the hang of it you can finish a round 15 minutes. The instructions are a little confusing so watch the Meeple University tutorial video on Youtube.
customer_reviews.author: F. H. Payne

customer_reviews.title: Hobby Boardgamer Rates it a 10
customer_reviews.text: I've been deep into the hobby of collecting and playing with designer cardboard for years now, and have built a collection of 100s of games. So, I've experienced a lot of different games, with different mechanics, strategies, etc. After more than two dozen plays of Azul, this game is one of only 2 which I rate a 10, and would play it any time someone suggests it. (The other game is Castles of Burgundy, by the way)
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Great game for four player
customer_reviews.text: This game is fairly easy to learn and a little addictive. My son brought it over for Thanksgiving and we all had a great time playing it, so much, that we bought one for ourselves. A maximum of four players, but you can play with 2 or 3. Everyone was new to the game , but we picked it up very quickly. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Fotobug

customer_reviews.title: Very strategic
customer_reviews.text: This is one of my favorite games. I highly recommend this game to people who love strategy. I wouldn’t recommend this as a “gateway” game for non-gamers. Definitely play something a little lighter first. This is a pretty simple game with really great replayability and strategy. Pretty good amounts of player interaction
customer_reviews.author: Zach G

customer_reviews.title: Great game - helps to have someone teach you
customer_reviews.text: I played this game with my neice and nephew at their house and loved it so much I bought it for the other kids in my life. This is a game that all ages can enjoy. It's not one of those boring "chance" games. I love when playing with kids doesn't feel like a chore. My only comment is that the instructions are a bit convoluted and it helps to play with someone who already knows how to play at first (and this is from someone who usually reads the instructions beginning to end before playing anything).
customer_reviews.author: Emily Greenfeld

customer_reviews.title: This board game is a hit!
customer_reviews.text: We usually enjoy a good board game at least twice a week as a couple/family to spend quality time together. This game was highly rated on BoardGameGeek, so we gave it a try. We are very happy with it, as it gives a proper mix of strategy, a desire to succeed, and a healthy dose of competition to make our time together fun and interesting. A definite A+ for a European style board game for the whole family!
customer_reviews.author: R

customer_reviews.title: Easy to pickup by kids
customer_reviews.text: Great game for the kids to get into. Took one gaming session for our 5 and 6 year old kids to get the hang of it and they loved it. You can see them already developing strategies as the game went on. The game is by no means overly simplistic, it just has a low learning curve. Kids have been asking to play constantly and we are happy to oblige. Game boards are well made. Tiles are beautiful and the tile drawstring carry bag is very nice too. This is definitely making it into our family board game rotation alongside Monopoly and Catan.
customer_reviews.author: Teej

customer_reviews.title: Unique in concept and gorgeous in its realization
customer_reviews.text: Finally a new concept in gaming! At one point lot of games are either memory-dépendant games, or mystery games, or miming games but this is new. A collecting items but with statistics calculation and strategy mixed in along with pure fun. And the look! All these colorful tiles with quality player cards. Love it so much I ordered the collection tiles and the joker tiles to make the game even more unique. Buy without reserve.
customer_reviews.author: X

customer_reviews.title: Really fun game
customer_reviews.text: This game is fun and quick to learn, but has a lot of strategy, so keeps being fun even after you've got the rules down. It plays in under an hour. The game is beautiful with nice colors and shapes to play with. Very pleasant to use. Unlike some other reviewers we had no quality problems. The game was in perfect shape when we received it. It also plays very well with just two people, unlike some "2-4" player games that are really only fun when you get 4 people to play. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Love this game! Read all the instructions!
customer_reviews.text: I love Azul. My boyfriend and I got this game as we started to get into board games and it is still one of our favorites. Note - you need to read through the entire rule book when you’re first learning to understand the gameplay fully. It felt confusing as we first sat down to learn but as we finished reading the rules, all our questions were answered. One play through was enough to grasp the concept. We completely enjoy this game and it will always be a favorite family game in our collection. Our friends are always asking to play it with us when they come over.
customer_reviews.author: Klafengler

customer_reviews.title: More challenging than it appears!
customer_reviews.text: I loved everything about this game! It was easy to learn & so addictive!!! We played multiple times in a row and multiple days in a row! The game seems so simple at first but after a few rounds the challenges are apparent. It was so much fun, and we basically took turns winning. There are ways to block your opponent if you're competitive, which adds another dimension of fun to the game. Finally, it's a beautiful game. The boards & tiles are very colorful. This has become an immediate favorite game!
customer_reviews.author: Virgo43

customer_reviews.title: Very fun family game
customer_reviews.text: Our family loves this game. We are a family of 4 and our two teenagers don’t ever complain when we ask them to play it. One my kids likes to strategize more than the other and it is always interesting to see how it plays out. There is a good mix of luck and strategy involved (more strategy than luck) to keep it interesting. There’s no aspect of this game that is rage-inducing, and it doesn’t take too long to get through the game. The child that strategizes the most usually wins, but everyone in our family has won at least once.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Instructions in German only
customer_reviews.text: Achtung! The game box is in English, but the instructions sent are entirely in German. I have no idea how to play the game, but at least the boards and pieces don't have any words on them.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Smith

customer_reviews.title: Fun for great variety of ages!
customer_reviews.text: It's a really fun game that moves quickly, with pretty little sit and wait time. The instructions are thorough, so you can learn to play without needing experienced players around. Once you understand it, the gameplay is actually very simple. Tween and early-elementary kiddos have both been eager to play it repeat times, and the adults find it just as playable. It's a great, great family game. Fun, not too long, not too slow, very playable.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph D. Ford

customer_reviews.title: A great game
customer_reviews.text: This is one that we played with my parents (4 people) and also regularly turn to when it's just my wife and I (2 people). It's an easy learning curve and game-play can be pretty surface-level or highly strategic (mostly depending on who you are playing with and how everyone's energy is at the time you're playing ;) ). HIGHLY recommend this game for people who enjoy Monopoly/Scrabble/Uno and other low-lift games as well as for people who like significantly more strategization (e.g. Carcasonne, Setllers of Catan, Killer Bunnies... and maybe anyone who buys all the games that win French and German gaming awards each year. ;) ).
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic addition to a family game night
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic addition to a family game night. Easy to learn, easy to play. Good pace, plays quickly. Not too much of a brain burner but there are some strategic decisions to be made. If you're into the boardgame hobby, it's a lightweight filler game, easy to pickup and teach/play. Quickly became a family favorite.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Stephens

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Challenging Game
customer_reviews.text: AZUL is an excellent game for almost everyone. It requires sharp mental acumen, careful planning/strategy and alertness. It can be played in 30-minutes, or even more challenging if you extend to the other play options. Adults, young adults, teenagers and middle school students can all enjoy this game.
customer_reviews.author: James E. Strickland

customer_reviews.title: Fun game for entire family
customer_reviews.text: We love this game! After one person reads the rules, it takes about 10 minutes to explain the concept to the rest of the group. Gorgeous tiles, reminiscent of Portugal, make this game pleasing to the eye. Ages 8+ should be able to pick up the game logic within one game. This game is part strategy, park luck. There isn't a central board; rather, everyone has their own. This is a fun non-card game that is best played at a table.
customer_reviews.author: Marco

customer_reviews.title: Quick to pick-up, deeper strategy follows
customer_reviews.text: What at first seems a simple matching game becomes something deep, fast. My player 2 and I are quickly throwing strategies at each other after only a few games. Try to end it early and squeeze out a victory? Go long, score high? Ignore some colors? Target what your opponent needs? No game is ever the same as random draws from the bag of tiles always present interesting combos. It gets down and dirty with two players, more can make for some very interesting matches. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED! This is a great game!
customer_reviews.author: E. J. W.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic gateway boardgame
customer_reviews.text: tl;dr Great boardgame that should be in every collection! This is a great boardgame and should be added to your collection today! Overall, it is fun, easy to learn, has deep underlying strategy, while not causing a lot of downtime between turns. The rules are simple and you can get into a game quickly. You can read the countless other reviews about how the game is played or the pros/cons. but overall this is a good game. One of the best from 2017 and in 10 years, will be one of the few that is still being made. It has that lasting of a hold. You should buy this!
customer_reviews.author: Collin Bartels

customer_reviews.title: Easy to teach, fun to play.
customer_reviews.text: One of my favorite games to play with folks just starting to get into strategy games. There aren't tons of different symbols or pieces so it's much less intimidating to newish players. I like the gameplay and it keeps you pretty active throughout the game. Both sides of the board are fun, but the backside is definitely for those playing a little longer since you have to remember more patterns and try out new strategies after learning the base.
customer_reviews.author: Brooke

customer_reviews.title: 2018 game of the year for a reason
customer_reviews.text: Bought this after hearing it won the prestigious Spiel des Jahres game of the year award for 2018. It lives up to the hype! Our family of 4 has been playing it every night for a week. The gameplay mechanics are incredibly easy to learn, yet it's got great strategy and risk vs. rewards elements as well. We've only played the base game so far, but I'm also anxious to try the variation where where the board is empty and you can pick where you put each type of tile. I expect Azul to be in heavy board game rotation in our house for the foreseeable future.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon F.

customer_reviews.title: Love this game!!
customer_reviews.text: I was nervous about ordering through here because of some of the other reviews. I decided to take the risk because Amazon is great about making things right if there's ever an issue, and I'm glad I did!! The game was shipped properly as to avoid damage, and all pieces were well made and accounted for. The game itself is aesthetically pleasing, fun, and easy to learn.
customer_reviews.author: Ashlee C.

customer_reviews.title: Great game
customer_reviews.text: Played this game at GenCon this year. Cheapest I could find it was 35 - and it would have been worth it. But, found it on Amazon for 31 and free shipping! Came earlier than expected (was on backorder). Great tile placement strategy game. Scales well with 2, 3, 4 players. Very simple to learn, difficult to master. Pieces are well made.
customer_reviews.author: Blair Henderson

customer_reviews.title: WOW..What a Game!
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I are avid board gamers and we just played Azul and love it! It's the kind of game that's easy to learn and play but leaves you thinking about a better strategy the next time you play. I am also really impressed by just how beautiful the game is made and even the instructions are done well. One recommendation is that you look at the Youtube videos to make it even easier to learn to play. Great game...highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Keif

customer_reviews.title: Azul is a Family Favorite
customer_reviews.text: Azul is great. It is simple, but yet offers players an opportunity to develop their own winning strategy. My family loves it and we love playing with friends as well. It is easy enough to play with your kids, maybe 7 years old and up, but more competitive and fun playing with your gaming friends. The tiles are very interesting and I love the Spanish/Portuguese feel to it. I highly recommend this game as a repeatable play for your library.
customer_reviews.author: The Big Smooth

customer_reviews.title: 10/10 wish the scale went higher for this -- so good
customer_reviews.text: One of my favorite board games. I am absolutely horrible at it (I consistently lose to literally everyone) but it's so good that I'll still play it any time it is brought up. 10/10 in every way
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Fun, colorful and challenging
customer_reviews.text: The game is easy to learn and play, but requires careful planning and strategy to win. Game parts are well done and should stand up to lots of playing. Once players learn the game, it moves quickly. A worthy addition to a game collection.
customer_reviews.author: mcmarauder

customer_reviews.title: Slow to start, but fun with experience
customer_reviews.text: The game is beautifully crafted, and the materials are clearly high-quality. It took a while for our family to learn the instructions and get going--it seems the instructions are written to be more complicated than the game actually is! It's also very hard to understand the strategies that will make you effective when you play for the first time. So the first game went slowly and didn't feel very strategic. The second time we played went much faster; by that point, too, we had strategies and understood what would actually matter. It's been more fun on these subsequent plays, and we like that it goes fast (a game could be done in 45 minutes to an hour).
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Fun game.
customer_reviews.text: This was a fun game to sit down and play with 4 family members. Well thought out game with quality pieces. I could see this game getting a lot of use on friend game nights.
customer_reviews.author: Mrdeedy

customer_reviews.title: More complex than you realize
customer_reviews.text: This game is so enjoyable. It's the first game I found that I really enjoy between two players, so much so that we played two games on the first night. The game is broken up into three sections: gathering tiles, which involves more strategy than you realize. Laying tiles, and each time you lay a tile you score it depending on what color and pattern. You can finish a game in just 30 minutes which is enjoyable compared to some other games we like. I also enjoyed the weight and texture of the plank tiles themselves, and the beautiful bag that they come in.
customer_reviews.author: Josefina Spiars

customer_reviews.title: Great for Beginners and Non-Beginners
customer_reviews.text: We are always on the lookout for fun and interesting board games, and this one is a winner. It is a great game for people who like to play board games a lot anyway. But it also works for people who don't really consider themselves board-gamers. The play itself is fairly simple, although sometimes it takes a few tries to learn to score properly. Plus, it's a visually beautiful game.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry

customer_reviews.title: We Choose This Game a Lot
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I are always looking for good 2 person games. I got this and hoped he would like it. Turns out, he loves it. I dare say we pick this game most of the time when we are playing just the 2 of us. I saw reviews that said the parts are cheap or defective. I did not experience that at all. Everything came in perfect shape, so I have no comment on the customer service level. We love this game.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Dechant

customer_reviews.title: Box was bent.
customer_reviews.text: Great game box was bent exterior package seemed fine. It was a gift so I gave it. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Hank Lincoln

customer_reviews.title: It's a good game, but got old fast.
customer_reviews.text: It's simple to learn and easy to set up. Good for quick family games. It's only 4 players, and there's a lot of different strategies, but I didn't find it generally fun. It's been sitting gathering dust for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Fun game once you figure it out
customer_reviews.text: This game is beautiful, but the instructions are very complicated, more so than is necessary really. Once you play a few rounds, it's fairly some, but the instructions are written for engineers, not your drunk friends at game night. As a side note, the tiles are the exact size and shape of Starburst candies, which very much entertained my less than sober inner child.
customer_reviews.author: Monica

customer_reviews.title: Box showed up smashed and with water damage
customer_reviews.text: Was very excited to play this game but it was delivered all smashed up (see photo) and with visible water damage even though it wasn't raining when delivered. The box itself wasn't study enough and would have benefitted from more sturdier packaging. Not sure who is more to blame but both the packaging of the seller and Amazon's delivery led to this item as damaged upon delivery.
customer_reviews.author: Jay C

customer_reviews.title: Such a fun game!
customer_reviews.text: My kids (10 and 8) really enjoyed this one. We sat down, set up in a little under 5 minutes, and started playing with no problems at all. They both enjoyed the strategy, and it allowed them to be competitive in such a way that it didn't cause any hard feelings -- not many competitive board games work out quite so elegantly in that way. Azul made for a fun evening, and a great little gaming session with the kids.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: This is a quality family game right here
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a competitive kinda guy. I'm partial to co-op games, but this game is slick. It's kind of like group Sudoku. There's a winner, but you're mostly competing with yourself to improve on your own methods. It's deceptively strategic as time goes on, but super easy to start up and play. Whether you like highly complex board games, or just want something that's quick to play, Azul is a pretty slick option to have in your boardgame closet.
customer_reviews.author: Jeph

customer_reviews.title: Fun
customer_reviews.text: We had to watch a YouTube video to help us understand the directions, but one we learned it was fun. We are more of a card game family, so it was nice to mix it up with this game. Great quality too!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel E.

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to learn game that is very replayable
customer_reviews.text: In this game you are collecting tiles to complete your masterpiece, each round you collect tiles to try to score the most points each round. My kids (5 and 6) enjoy playing it with my wife and me, and although they don't win, they like to play. We have to help them with the scoring, but the concept of tile collection is very easy for them to understand.
customer_reviews.author: @Andy_doug

customer_reviews.title: Super fun, easy to learn, easy set up!
customer_reviews.text: This is such a great game for both board game fanatics and non gamers. It's easy to teach, simple to set up, plays in under an hour, and it's FUN! Azul is an abstract tile placement that features drafting, set collecting and pattern building. It's pleasing to look at and the components are well made. The tiles feel especially nice. This is one of those games that everyone we've introduced it to loves, and wants to play again right away. It hits the table quite a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly

customer_reviews.title: Good game for small group
customer_reviews.text: I know a lot of people who are crazy about this game right now but it's just ok for me. It's enjoyable. The scoring gets a bit complicated and I hate that it's only 4 players so we can't pull it out on big game nights.
customer_reviews.author: Buyer Bre

customer_reviews.title: Family's Favorite Game
customer_reviews.text: It is easy to learn and seems too simple at first. But after a few rounds, it becomes very addictive. Now we play game after game. The colors are cheerful. Azul has become our favorite game and we highly recommend it! It is great for the whole family to enjoy. The only drawback is 4 max players. Still, the games are fairly quick, so you can rotate or even play as teams if you have a larger family. Even the box is high quality.
customer_reviews.author: grannygeorge

customer_reviews.title: Fun game for all ages
customer_reviews.text: This game was great to play with my 80 year old mom, my teenage children (one with severe dyslexia so reading games are out of the question), and my young adult nephew who is high functioning autistic. It took us about 3 rounds to really understand the strategy behind it. Instructions are not super clear so we took it step by step and played as we read the instructions. Once we got it, we were hooked. And it's pretty!
customer_reviews.author: Karlsrud

customer_reviews.title: Awesome (and not fake)
customer_reviews.text: After reading the reviews, I risked buying this. I immediately opened and counted all tiles and everything appears to be correct. The one I received is the second edition and was packed well (by Amazon) and in good condition (one minor box ding). It doesn't bother me because the box will take a beating anyways. Beautiful tiles and I can't wait to play it.
customer_reviews.author: Emma

customer_reviews.title: One of mty favorites
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful quality. Great game for family to play. We play a lot of games and this is one we go back to often. Lots of twists and turns as other players take the pieces you need. Luck and skill together.
customer_reviews.author: C. Terry

customer_reviews.title: A great strategy game
customer_reviews.text: I love to play this game and even the grandkids, ages 11 and 8, love playing this one. It always help when you play this the first time with someone who is familiar with the game to get into the rules and strategy (I had my daughter and son in law who already own the game who love it too). There are not a lot of rules to remember...the kids didn’t have any trouble!
customer_reviews.author: Alive in Wisconsin

customer_reviews.title: Essential for a game collection
customer_reviews.text: What can I say? It’s basically a perfect game. Easy to learn but has a lot of depth as you get more acquainted. And it passed the wife test ( my wife admittedly hates games- but she will play this one with me every time). I gifted it 2x for Christmas 2019. Both parties loved it. This is a must for your collection. Get it!
customer_reviews.author: Pop Tarts?! ROFL

customer_reviews.title: Fun game
customer_reviews.text: I really like this game it's a lot of fun and takes a certain amount of strategy to play. However, I felt like a bit of a dummy when I first got it because the play is done in stages, and I couldn't understand the directions, so I needed to watch a Youtube to understand the progression of play. I would definitely recommend this game for family fun.
customer_reviews.author: GAYLENE AUSTIN

customer_reviews.title: Great game to play with family and friends, great replayability!
customer_reviews.text: Great family game that is pretty easy to learn how to play. Takes a few plays to start to establish different strategies to use to maximize points and to understand gameplay. We have already given copies to many of our family members who also enjoy the game as much as we do; they have in turn also shared and played with their friends and family.
customer_reviews.author: G. Tom

customer_reviews.title: Unique strategy game
customer_reviews.text: It seems like most boardgames today operate as variations on about 3 different base game play themes. The thing I really like about Azul is that game play is totally different from anything else I’ve seen on the market. Add to that the hint of luck and heap of strategy required to win, and this is truly a great game. It’s also aesthetically beautiful, adding to the joy of playing. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca W

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter taught me this game -- she is always looking for new games to play. this was a winner! i bought one for us (we live some 500 miles apart) and we play it all the time. Fast, fun, a little strategy involved, but not so much that you have to think hard, our kind of game!! it even came with a really nice bag to hold the tiles in, both storage and play.
customer_reviews.author: Doris Gilkey

customer_reviews.title: Great entry-level Game
customer_reviews.text: This is a great entry level game for people who want a fun, easy to learn and teach game, that can be as thoughtful as you like. Comes with two variations so it can be as entry level or challenging as you and your friends/family want.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Very pretty, very fun
customer_reviews.text: You can learn the basics of Azul in one or two play throughs. By the fourth or fifth game, it totally smooths out and feels super intuitive. By the sixth game, the depth of strategy and game theory begins to reveal itself, when at first the tile placement felt arbitrary. This game is as fun to play as it is to look at, and the tacticle sensation of the resin tiles is a pleasing thing that you can't experience with a phone app. As an added bonus, the price on Amazon a little more than half the price in retail stores. Buy it here, buy it now!
customer_reviews.author: Mike FM

customer_reviews.title: Such a great game!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for fun two player games my boyfriend and I could play out at diners/cafes. This game fits perfectly at a diner table, it has a fairly small footprint all things considered. It was so easy to learn, and the tiles are very pretty. I also like the weight of them, they seem well made. I'm definitely looking forward to picking up the expansion for this game!
customer_reviews.author: Daleryn

customer_reviews.title: Great Game
customer_reviews.text: We were introduced to this at a friend's place and we loved it there. We bought thinking this would make a great entertainer at our place. It wasn't a hit with any of our friends, I guess it was a little hard for everyone to get it, especially the points calculation part. None of our friends agree to play it anymore. LOL. We still love it.
customer_reviews.author: chinar

customer_reviews.title: Good Buy
customer_reviews.text: Let me preface by saying I really enjoy this game! 2 players can be a little cut throat as you can make people take lots of negative points as your strategy. The point system is a little wonky, and the rule book could include better examples. The game isn't complicated by any means. I just had to double check some rules online before playing my second game.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Doney

customer_reviews.title: Fun
customer_reviews.text: I like this game but it was a little harder to learn than some. It helped a lot when I went on YouTube and saw a visual teaching example. Fun and strategic game
customer_reviews.author: wy

customer_reviews.title: Really Fun Tile Game
customer_reviews.text: A friend introduced me to this game a few months ago and I just had to buy it. Lots of strategy and fun to see who can get the most points. Tried to play with my 9:year old grandson but it was too difficult for him to pick up the strategy. You are always second guessing the other players strategy. So many different ways to score extra points which makes it even more fun to play.
customer_reviews.author: jedipeg

customer_reviews.title: CURRENT FAVORITE GAME
customer_reviews.text: We bought this game during Prime Days after only knowing people who had played it in the past and enjoyed it. My husband and I were specifically looking for a game that was compatiable to play together (2 player) and didn't take hours to finish a game. We can play a game in 20 minutes. We enjoying playing the game very much and can't wait to play it with friends.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Meissner

customer_reviews.title: The game is great but it arrived late and was damaged.
customer_reviews.text: I love this game and it is tons of fun! The only complaint I have is that it did not arrive on time and when it did arrive the corner of the box was damaged. The game itself is great and I recommend it to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey

customer_reviews.title: Like a day at the spa.
customer_reviews.text: Loved this game. It's one of those games that's tricky to learn at first, but once you figure it out, you're good to go. Very chill and relaxed feel, which is nice because some games stress me the heck out. Monopoly? Yeah, that'll tear a friendship apart. Azul? You'll feel like you're getting out of a warm bubble bath.
customer_reviews.author: Caitybates

customer_reviews.title: Azul- fun tile placement game
customer_reviews.text: Fairly easy to learn tile placing game for 2 players up. Solid quality pieces, and easy to learn. You chose tiles to place on your mat “wall” using strategy to get the most points. Nice bright colors and the tiles are plastic and printed well so they don’t lose their design. A great replayable game!
customer_reviews.author: K. L. Bauer

customer_reviews.title: Sudoku meets table top gaming
customer_reviews.text: This is a great game that doesn't take too much to learn. With options to use the predefined colors on one side of the board or to create-your-own sudoku style layout on the other, it is easy to get hard-core gamers and recreational gamers at the same table to enjoy the game in the way THEY want. Fun game and would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: RbrDucky

customer_reviews.title: Pretty, simple, and fun game
customer_reviews.text: The hardest part about this game is how the points are calculated. Other than that, it’s a great game that’s fairly easy to pick up. Many of my friends/family comment on how pretty of a game it is. It’s true, the tiles are very beautiful. I like how the game is simple enough that even my “non-game loving” friends pick up on how to play it easily.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Ellison

customer_reviews.title: A New Favorite
customer_reviews.text: We recently acquired Azul, and it has quickly become a family favorite. It works well as both a 2 person game, and for 3 or 4. My 10 year old picked it up quickly. It's a litter harder for my 7 year old, but she can play (with some help) and i'm sure will be beating us all soundly soon. When you first play, it seems simple, but the more you play you realize how complex the game play can really be (and also how much fun it is to sabotage others). Totally worth adding to your board game collection.
customer_reviews.author: Alison Rieger

customer_reviews.title: Fun game!
customer_reviews.text: We love this game! While the instructions seem confusing, once you learn how to apply the rules, it is a really fun game. We have played it with other adults and we have played it with grandkids from age 8 to 12. It is limited to 4 players but it is also fun for just 2. It does not take long to play the game. This is a new family favorite!
customer_reviews.author: Margaret B

customer_reviews.title: Very colorful
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure whether to buy or not because of the mixed reviews. I'm glad I decided to. The one I got looks well made, no wear spots or torn edges. I've read the directions and though detailed, they look easy enough to follow. I'm bringing it over to a friend's house today and we'll test it out.
customer_reviews.author: B. Jasper

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Learn. Fun to play.
customer_reviews.text: I struggle teaching games to my gaming group. My group is very varied when it comes to learning/skill. Half prefer simpler styled games over heavy strategy, while the other half find the simple games mundane. Azul exists in the middle of the two. Like Ticket to Ride, Catan, and Pandemic. It can be taught quickly. Played quickly. And it's deep and rich enough for everyone. This game quickly made it's way to the top of our frequent return list. Additional info: My copy shipped straight from China. The box was destroyed, and pieces were actually missing. However, I reached out to Plan B Games. Within a week, I had all the missing pieces! Great people there.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Sweeten

product_meta.title: Plan B Games Azul Board Game Board Games, Multi-Colored, Full Pack
product_meta.description: Azul was designed by the world famous, award winning game author Michael Riesling. Azul captures the beautiful aesthetics of Moorish art in a contemporary board game. Players compete as artisans decorating the walls of the royal Palace of Dvora. By carefully drafting the correct Quantity and style of tiles, the most clever of artisans plan ahead to maximize the beauty of their work (not to mention their scores!) while ensuring they wasted no supplies in the process. Introduced by the moors, "azulejos" (originally white and blue ceramic tiles) were fully embraced by the Portuguese, when their King Manuel I, on a visit to the Alhambra Palace in Southern Spain, was mesmerized by the stunning beauty of the Moorish decorative tiles. The King, awestruck by the interior beauty of the Alhambra, immediately ordered that his own Palace in Portugal be decorated with similar wall tiles. As a tile laying artist, you have been challenged to embellish the walls of the royal Palace of Dvora.
feature_bullets: High quality components and fun, accessible gameplay
Fun tile drafting and tile placement mechanics

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
